summary: The document is a classified dispatch detailing an unsuccessful exfiltration attempt from Cuba to the U.S. in May 1964, involving a group attempting to rescue family members of AMLEO-3, a person under the control of KUBARK (a codename for the CIA). The operation, codenamed M/V ADA, was independently organized by AMLEO-3 after KUBARK ceased its efforts to assist in the asylum of his family. The mission faced numerous challenges, including being fired upon by Cuban authorities, and ultimately failed to rescue AMLEO-3's family. The document provides a detailed account of the operation, including the participants, the sequence of events, and the aftermath.
key_findings: AMLEO-3 organized the exfiltration attempt independently after KUBARK discontinued its support.
The operation involved a boat named M/V ADA and a crew attempting to rescue family members from Cuba.
The mission was compromised by Cuban authorities, leading to a firefight and the injury of one crew member.
The document highlights the desperation of AMLEO-3 and the risks involved in such clandestine operations.
It also reveals operational inconsistencies and the withholding of information by participants.
